definition: gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)

sentences.english: If only I could get out of my timidness, I would feel better.
sentences.chinese: 只要我改掉自己膽怯的缺點，我就能感覺好點。

sentences.english: Mr. Smith, a very white man, but a very yellow one.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生是位忠實可靠的人，但他很膽怯。

sentences.english: I was a nervous child, and when I grew, I was a nervous young man.
sentences.chinese: 我從小膽小怯弱，長大了，仍是一個膽怯的年輕人。

sentences.english: The challenger showed the white feather as soon as he stepped into the ring with the champion.
sentences.chinese: 這位挑戰者同冠軍一踏進拳擊場時就膽怯了。

sentences.english: Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment.
sentences.chinese: 一個軍官作出如此膽怯的行爲使整個團都蒙受羞辱。

sentences.english: Sweet is for lily-livered puff balls made of much softer stuff than you.
sentences.chinese: 甜蜜就是用比你更柔軟的材料爲膽怯而做的煙霧彈。

sentences.english: I walked into the centre of the bazaar timidly.
sentences.chinese: 我膽怯着走到集市中間。

sentences.english: Naturally, faint-hearted investors failed the test.
sentences.chinese: 當然，那些膽怯的投資者未能經受住市場的考驗。

sentences.english: This includes the shy dogs and the fear biters.
sentences.chinese: 這其中包括膽怯羞愧和出於畏懼而攻擊的犬隻。

sentences.english: It is a cowardly pride which would choose a downy pillow and a silken couch for a soldier of the cross.
sentences.chinese: 膽怯的驕傲爲十字架的兵士選擇羽毛枕頭和絲緞臥榻。

sentences.english: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
sentences.chinese: 你在患難之日若膽怯，你的力量就微小。

sentences.english: The boy chickened out of climbing up the tree.
sentences.chinese: 男孩膽怯了，不敢爬上這棵樹。

sentences.english: Stress and fear making way for happiness and time with your loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 讓壓力和膽怯爲幸福與可愛的人共度良宵讓道。

sentences.english: E. g. The little boy stepped forward timidly and shook Leo's hand.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩膽怯地走向前去，握住里奧的手。

sentences.english: And stifled thee, their minister. I know.
sentences.chinese: 膽怯和淫猥，使得你窒息。

sentences.english: He twitted his friend with his timidity.

definition: lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
